lenders.name: Ryan
lenders.loan_because: Used to make loans because I felt it made a meaningful difference in the borrowers lives and helped them, at least slightly, extricate themselves from a life of poverty. Now I plan to quit Kiva and never loan again because I do not believe debt finance is a fair and compassionate method to help the world's poorer entrepreneurs. I do not want undue burdens to be placed on the borrowers should their plan not work out. I suggest others do the same so more do not end up like many of the borrowers of Grameen bank in India.
lenders.occupational_info: I count beans and do paperwork.

lenders.name: Kimber
lenders.loan_because: We are not alone in the world and we all can help, wherever help is needed, even if it's just a little.  A little at a time adds up to a lot!
lenders.occupational_info:
Hello!  My name is Kimber and for many years now I have been a teacher in the Venice and Santa Monica area in Southern California.  I recently started The Children's Caring and Sharing Community Project.  I'm so excited that this program is now being incorporated as part of several local school's monthly curriculum and weekly lesson plans.  Lending programs like KIVA are an important part of this positive social caring project.

We hope to inspire children to be active participants in their communities.  And isn't the world one large community?  

Children are generous by nature and are starting to be proactive and fire up amazing changes on their own.  Children of all ages are really wanting to help and are looking for ways to make a powerful impact.  Kiva is perfect!  With the help of their families and their community, just imagine what they can do!

Growing, sharing, learning, loving and giving are all part of what we want to instill and support in our children.  And this is a great place to help teach those lessons -- by helping other people around the world.  It starts with us!

Love Always - Kimber Luederitz
